<|ref|>title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 121, 636, 145]]<|/det|> # Cambridge International AS & A Level <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 170, 195, 201]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NAME <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 221, 175, 250]]<|/det|> CENTRE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[210, 210, 425, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[620, 220, 720, 250]]<|/det|> CANDIDATE NUMBER <|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[737, 210, 905, 255]]<|/det|> <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 277, 178, 293]]<|/det|> ## PHYSICS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[832, 277, 905, 293]]<|/det|> 9702/31 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 301, 359, 317]]<|/det|> Paper 3 Advanced Practical Skills 1 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[782, 301, 905, 317]]<|/det|> May/June 2023 <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[841, 326, 905, 341]]<|/det|> 2 hours <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 355, 393, 371]]<|/det|> You must answer on the question paper. <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 384, 700, 401]]<|/det|> You will need: The materials and apparatus listed in the confidential instructions <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 419, 230, 435]]<|/det|> ## INSTRUCTIONS <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 435, 890, 605]]<|/det|> INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- You will be allowed to work with the apparatus for a maximum of 1 hour for each question.- You should record all your observations in the spaces provided in the question paper as soon as these observations are made.- You may use a calculator.- You should show all your working and use appropriate units. <|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 634, 220, 649]]<|/det|> ## INFORMATION <|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 650, 729, 682]]<|/det|> INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 40.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ]. <|ref|>table<|/ref|><|det|>[[712, 712, 907, 840]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[386, 868, 611, 884]]<|/det|> This document has 12 pages.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 72, 740, 91]]<|/det|>
**You may not need to use all of the materials provided.**

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[77, 102, 96, 120]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 623, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate a balanced metre rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 902, 152]]<|/det|>
You have been provided with three springs and a metre rule with masses attached to its centre.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 165, 146, 183]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 164, 734, 183]]<|/det|>
The unstretched length of the single spring is \(S_{1}\), as shown in Fig. 1.1.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[260, 197, 714, 319]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 336, 532, 354]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 368, 781, 387]]<|/det|>
The unstretched length of the connected springs is \(S_{2}\), as shown in Fig. 1.2.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[161, 395, 833, 476]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 494, 534, 513]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 527, 418, 545]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(S_{1}\) and \(S_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 586, 917, 606]]<|/det|>
<form>S_{1} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 632, 920, 653]]<|/det|>
<form>S_{2} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[895, 650, 922, 668]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 146, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 185, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 72, 584, 89]]<|/det|>
Set up the apparatus as shown in Fig. 1.3.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[129, 100, 870, 405]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 418, 534, 437]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.3</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 450, 220, 467]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[232, 450, 635, 467]]<|/det|>
Two string loops A and B are supporting the rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 480, 712, 498]]<|/det|>
Loop A should be placed 10.0 cm from one end of the rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 511, 212, 529]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 511, 920, 545]]<|/det|>
The distance between the end of the rule and loop B is \(x\). Move loop B until \(x\) is approximately \(75 \text{cm}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 558, 212, 576]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 558, 421, 576]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(x\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[554, 588, 920, 606]]<|/det|>
<form>x = ................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 619, 212, 637]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 619, 920, 653]]<|/det|>
Without changing the positions of the string loops, adjust the apparatus until the rule is parallel to the bench and the springs and the string loops are vertical.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 666, 212, 684]]<|/det|>
<label>●</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 666, 611, 684]]<|/det|>
The extended length of the single spring is \(L_{1}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 682, 658, 700]]<|/det|>
The extended length of the connected springs is \(L_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[230, 712, 490, 730]]<|/det|>
Measure and record \(L_{1}\) and \(L_{2}\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 742, 918, 761]]<|/det|>
<form>L_{1} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 774, 918, 793]]<|/det|>
<form>L_{2} = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 789, 920, 808]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 821, 181, 839]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 821, 420, 839]]<|/det|>
Calculate \(e_1\) and \(e_2\), where

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[371, 851, 628, 871]]<|/det|>
\[e_1 = L_1 - S_1 \text{ and } e_2 = L_2 - S_2.\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 883, 920, 901]]<|/det|>
<form>e_1 = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[544, 913, 920, 931]]<|/det|>
<form>e_2 = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 928, 920, 946]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 89]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 72, 918, 106]]<|/det|>
Vary \(x\) by changing the position of loop B. Loop B must remain on the right-hand side of the masses. Keep loop A in the same position.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 117, 920, 167]]<|/det|>
For each value of x, adjust the apparatus until the rule is parallel to the bench and the springs and the string loops are vertical. Measure x, \(L_{1}\) and \(L_{2}\). Repeat until you have five sets of values.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 178, 781, 203]]<|/det|>
Record your results in a table. Include values of \(e_1\), \(e_2\) and \(\frac{e_2}{e_1}\) in your table.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 542, 920, 560]]<|/det|>
<mark>[8]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 572, 144, 591]]<|/det|>
<label>(d)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[146, 572, 175, 590]]<|/det|>
<label>(i)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 567, 655, 597]]<|/det|>
Plot a graph of \(\frac{\Theta_2}{\Theta_1}\) on the \(y\)-axis against \(x\) on the \(x\)-axis.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 571, 920, 590]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 603, 180, 621]]<|/det|>
<label>(ii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[193, 603, 457, 621]]<|/det|>
Draw the straight line of best fit.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 603, 920, 621]]<|/det|>
<mark>[1]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[144, 634, 180, 653]]<|/det|>
<label>(iii)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[191, 634, 608, 653]]<|/det|>
Determine the gradient and \(y\)-intercept of this line.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[490, 839, 917, 857]]<|/det|>
<form>gradient = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[475, 870, 917, 888]]<|/det|>
<form>y-intercept = ............................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 885, 920, 903]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 72, 144, 91]]<|/det|>
<label>(e)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 72, 759, 92]]<|/det|>
It is suggested that the quantities \(e_1\), \(e_2\) and \(x\) are related by the equation

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[447, 95, 551, 125]]<|/det|>
\[\frac{\mathrm{e}_2}{\mathrm{e}_1} = Px - Q\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 133, 405, 152]]<|/det|>
where \(P\) and \(Q\) are constants.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 163, 680, 183]]<|/det|>
Using your answers in **(d)**(iii), determine the values of \(P\) and \(Q\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 180, 346, 198]]<|/det|>
Give appropriate units.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 272, 917, 291]]<|/det|>
<form>P = ................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[551, 303, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<form>Q = ................................................................

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 319, 920, 337]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 350, 143, 369]]<|/det|>
<label>(f)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 350, 875, 369]]<|/det|>
The distance between string loop A and the centre of the rule is \(w\), as shown in Fig. 1.4.

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[220, 380, 776, 572]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>image_caption<|/ref|><|det|>[[463, 588, 534, 606]]<|/det|>
<label>Fig. 1.4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 619, 531, 638]]<|/det|>
\(P\) and \(Q\) are each inversely proportional to \(w\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 650, 920, 669]]<|/det|>
A student repeats the experiment with loop A placed further from the left-hand end of the rule.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 682, 685, 700]]<|/det|>
Sketch a second line on the graph to show the expected results.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 698, 299, 715]]<|/det|>
Label this line W.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 698, 920, 715]]<|/det|>

<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 102, 850, 121]]<|/det|>
In this experiment, you will investigate the oscillations of a wooden strip and a pendulum.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 133, 685, 152]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 164, 144, 183]]<|/det|>
